title: maxHelper with int array instance variable

content.description: The following question refer to the following information.
content.question: Consider the following data field and method. Method maxHelper is intended to return the largest value among the first numVals values in an array; however, maxHelper does not work as intended. private int[] nums; // precondition: 0 < numVals <= nums.length private int maxHelper(int numVals) { Line 1: int max = maxHelper(numVals - 1); Line 2: if (max > nums[numVals - 1]) return max; else return nums[numVals - 1]; } Which of the following best describes the conditions under which maxHelper does not work as intended?

choices.label: When the elements of nums are in nonincreasing order
When the elements of nums are in nondecreasing order
Method maxHelper never works as intended.

content.answer: Method maxHelper never works as intended.

skill.text: 4.B: Describe the initial conditions that must be met for a code segment to work as intended or described.
